page.title: 05Ashington Colliery.
page.content:
Ashington is here because there is coal underground. Ashington colliery opened in 1850.It is now the only mine in the town,and one of the few mines in Northumberland .580 men work underground.They produce 1,300 tons of coal a day.There are surface workers who sort and clean the coal.The mechanics and engineers repair underground and surface machinery.The colliery has not changed much since it was first opened.They think it will run out of coal in 1992.
My dad works at Ashington Colliery.He digs coal out of the ground and uses a big coal cutter with his friend.It is pretty dark down the mine and after school I wait for him coming home from work in the NCB car park.My dad likes working down the pit.
